questions.question_text:
A bank is looking for improved customer experience for applications and reduce overhead related to compliance and security. Which key feature or features of the
Cisco SD-WAN solution will help the bank to achieve their goals?

discussion.content:
This should be B. Ref below page 51 and 52
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/solutions/collateral/enterprise-networks/sd-wan/nb-06-cisco-sd-wan-ebook-cte-en.pdf

Selected Answer: B
CORRECT ANSWER "B"
very textual and 90% similar to the case study of the link:
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/solutions/collateral/enterprise-networks/sd-wan/nb-06-cisco-sd-wan-ebook-cte-en.pdf


page 51 and 52

and there is a change in:

""The Cisco SD-WAN solution is able to provide:
• Quality of Service, including application prioritization and choosing the
optimized path based on required SLAs for critical applications.
• Circuit remediation for critical traffic, so as to improve the end-user experience
for traffic traversing poor quality circuits.
• Integration into cloud "SaaS and IaaS" (DOES NOT INDICATE PaaS) providers to offer the best possible
application experience""

Selected Answer: B
- Improve customer experience for applications
-Reduce overhead related to compliance and security.
-->The chosen solution was a managed service built with Cisco SD-WAN which
dramatically improved service delivery and quality of experience.
-->Application performance improved due to dynamic SLA-based traffic routing over MPLS, internet, and LTE circuits.

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/solutions/collateral/enterprise-networks/sd-wan/nb-06-cisco-sd-wan-ebook-cte-en.pdf (P51,52,53)

questions.question_text: When software is upgraded on a vManage NMS, which two image-adding options store images in a local vManage software repository? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The Cisco vManage software repository allows you to store images in three ways:

On the local Cisco vManage server, to be downloaded over a control plane connection: Here, the software images are stored on the local Cisco vManage server, and they are downloaded to the Cisco SD-WAN devices over a control plane connection. The receiving device generally throttles the amount of data traffic it can receive over a control plane connection, so for large files, the Cisco vManage server might not be able to monitor the software installation on the device even though it is proceeding correctly.

comments.content:
On a remote server: From Cisco vManage Release 20.7.1, you can store software images on a remote file server that is reachable through an FTP or HTTP URL. As part of the software upgrade process, the Cisco vManage server sends this URL to the Cisco SD-WAN device, which establishes a connection to the file server to download the software images. In a multitenant Cisco SD-WAN deployment, only the provider can register a remote server with Cisco vManage and add locations of software images on the remote server to the Cisco vManage repository.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/Monitor-And-Maintain/monitor-maintain-book/maintain.html#concept_lpv_ggg_5rb

On the local Cisco vManage server, to be downloaded over an out-of-band connection: Here, the software images are stored on the local Cisco vManage server, and they are downloaded to the Cisco SD-WAN devices over an out-of-band management connection. For this method to work, you specify the IP address of the out-of-band management interface when you copy the images to the software repository. This method is recommended when the software image files are large, because it bypasses any throttling that the device might perform and so the Cisco vManage server is able to monitor the software installation.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
yes its correct
Answer is correct, doc link provided in the question.

choices.A: To be downloaded over an ICMP connection
choices.C: To be downloaded over a control plane connection
choices.E: To be downloaded over a SMTP connection
choices.D: To be downloaded over an out-of-band connection
choices.B: To be downloaded over a SNMP connection
